intro: Urophyllum negrosense, commonly known as the Negros uruphyllo, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
